item.title: Biohazard contamination – pigeon droppings and dust near water-tank access, Shacklewell House, E8 2EQ, 22nd October
item.description:
Pigeon guano, feathers and dust contamination on landing by water-tank hatch above Flat 35, Shacklewell House, E8 2EQ. Present for over a week and uncleaned. Area is beside the block’s water-tank access and may pose a health risk. Urgent cleaning and Envir

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shacklewell Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: Debris from collision blocking road, road impassible, 22nd October
item.description:
Highview Road is impassible due to debris from what looks like a hit & run collision, unable to drive over it due to large sharp sections of debris in the road as I found out at 03:30 22/10/2025 on my route home.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Highview Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London

item.title: Rubbish in bin chute room, 22nd October
item.description:
LFB attended a fire in the bin chute room on 2nd floor of Wigram court. There were large quantities of debris, including combustibles like cardboard, strewn across the floor, not in refuse containers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battersea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road problems, 22nd October
item.description:
The whole road is uneven and outside 248D there is a crossing for pedestrians. Some of Bellegrove Road was resurfaced in March but there is a slight bump that is shaking the houses at all hours as well as potholes and cracks in the road. There are some sleepless nights due to this. Please can the entire road be resurfaced and repainted as the lines are slowly fading away and it isn’t fair for residents to have sleepless nights. On another note can speed bumps be put into this road as there are a lot of speeders at all hours which keeps residents awake and is a danger to pedestrians as they are overtaking other vehicles near pedestrian crossings. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Shouldham Street, Marylebone, London

item.title: Fly tipping on Harton Road N9, 21st October
item.description:
Household rubbish again, the regular weekend routine. Among the items, there is packaging displaying a name and address (photo attached). This ongoing issue continues to cause significant nuisance to residents. Even though the end-of-terrace property has installed CCTV in this area, fly-tipping still occurs because of the council’s weak enforcement approach. The council must now take stronger action and issue fines to deter repeat offenders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping at Haberdasher Place, 21st October
item.description:
Fly tipping yet again - this rubbish is starting to smell and it contains food items. Risk of rotting and attracting pests. Fly tipping at bins on either side of Haberdasher Place. Please remove ASAP

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Haberdasher Street, Hackney, London
